alert.note: Alert for Belknap; Grafton (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 30 at 11:12PM EDT until May 02 at 4:00AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Pemigewasset River At Woodstock affecting Grafton County. Pemigewasset River At Plymouth affecting Belknap and Grafton Counties. Suncook River At North Chichester affecting Belknap and Merrimack Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Maine... New Hampshire... Saco River At Conway affecting Cumberland, Oxford and Carroll Counties. Swift River At Roxbury affecting Oxford County. For the Pemigewasset River...including Woodstock, Plymouth...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Saco River...including Conway, West Buxton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Swift River...including Roxbury...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Suncook River...including North Chichester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING TO EARLY TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Pemigewasset River at Plymouth. * WHEN...From Monday morning to early Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. At 14.0 feet, Water enters the parking lot behind the PSU ice arena. At 15.0 feet, Flood waters up to the road at the Irving station on route 175A in Holderness. At 15.5 feet, Flood waters over the road at the Irving station on route 175A in Holderness. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EDT Sunday the stage was 2.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late tomorrow morning to a crest of 15.6 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
